alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 6:34AM EST until February 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Cazenovia Creek Near Ebenezer affecting Erie County. Buffalo Creek Near Gardenville affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. .The following flood warnings are for high flows from rain and snowmelt. Potential ice jams later today and tonight may result in more significant flooding localized near ice jams. For the Cazenovia Creek...including Ebenezer...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Buffalo Creek...including Gardenville...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cayuga Creek...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster. * WHEN...From this evening through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flood stage, minor flooding in low lying areas of Lancaster and Alden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 8.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 06/13/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
